alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:47AM PST until January 10 at 5:45AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central San Luis Obispo County in southwestern California... * Until 545 AM PST. * At 447 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Pismo Beach, Arroyo Grande, Grover Beach, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Shell Beach, Santa Margarita, Avila Beach, Lake Lopez, Oceano, Baywood-Los Osos and Diablo Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
